thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn accused of mouthing 'stupid woman' at Theresa May during PMQs

author: Kathryn Riddell
title: Jeremy Corbyn accused of mouthing 'stupid woman' at Theresa May during PMQs
text:
News Jeremy Corbyn accused of mouthing 'stupid woman' at Theresa May during PMQs The Labour leader was called out on social media after allegedly mouthing the insult in the House of Commons Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Jeremy Corbyn has denied calling Theresa May a "stupid woman" during a fiery Prime Minister's Questions.
A video of the session on Wednesday showed the Labour leader saying something under his breath after the Prime Minister likened Labour 's attempt to table a no confidence motion against her to a pantomime.
Health Secretary Matt Hancock wrote on Twitter : "The mask slips. Jeremy Corbyn's abuse of the Prime Minister shows what a reactionary misogynist he is".
He added: "Unreal how Corbyn supporters are actually *defending* him calling the PM a "stupid woman". Sickening. This misogyny now runs deep in Corbyn's Labour - and runs right to the top." Read More PMQs LIVE: Updates as Jeremy Corbyn is accused of calling Theresa May a 'stupid woman'
Conservative Party chairman Brandon Lewis said on Twitter: "Will @jeremycorbyn apologise or clarify exactly what he was saying? Looks shocking on the film, unacceptable in any environment."
But a spokesman for Mr Corbyn said: "He did not call her a stupid woman. He was saying 'stupid people'."
Mr Corbyn had demanded to know when Mrs May will actually meet EU leaders to get their approval for changes to her Brexit plan.
During PMQs, he asked: "She's now claiming she's still seeking further assurances while all the time running down the clock on the alternatives. So can she explain to us when the European Council will meet to approve the changes they have already ruled out?" Prime Minister Theresa May speaks during Prime Minister's Questions in the House of Commons (Image: PA)
Mrs May dodged the question, instead attacking Mr Corbyn for his lack of an alternative to her Brexit deal.
She said: "Week after week he has stood here on this issue and talked about what he is against. He never says what he is for.
"He can talk all he likes about a meaningful vote - after he gives us a meaningful position."
It came after a fraught exchange, in which Mr Corbyn reminded Mrs May the next meeting of the European Council was not until March.
Mrs May said her "achievements" with EU negotiators would be set out in the new year and again insisted Mr Corbyn had no alternative Brexit deal. Read More
She said: "I know it's Christmas and he has looked in his stocking, down the chimney, under the Christmas tree, but he still has not found a Brexit plan.
"He has to accept his responsibility for delivering on Brexit." Like us on Facebook
